definition: (neologism 2015) the Zhao family (derogatory term for those who hold power in the PRC)
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
the Zhou family (household, firm etc)/Jow-Ga Kung Fu - Martial Art
learned person/expert in a certain field/abbr. for 大方之家[da4 fang1 zhi1 jia1]
the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
(respectful for) one's grandfather/sb's father/older people/the head of the house (used by servants)/a district magistrate
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
erhua variant of 兒媳婦|儿媳妇[er2 xi2 fu5]
